body: FYI, sanity failing (check_submodules and check sources and headers).

Why doesn't the CMake stuff pull its configuration from build.yaml?

On Fri, Oct 6, 2017 at 1:47 AM Jan Tattermusch <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> *@jtattermusch* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In CMakeLists.txt
> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/12843#discussion_r143137635>:
>
> > @@ -758,6 +758,7 @@ endif()
>  add_dependencies(buildtests_cxx stress_test)
>
> Actually, you should at least add a comment to CMakeLists.txt.template
> saying that we're using header-only stuff from abseil so we didn't setup
> proper dependency the way it's done for other third_party deps.
>
> Btw, seems like abseil only supports building with bazel - so currently we
> cannot use anything else than header-only stuff unless we want to write
> Makefile and CMakeLists.txt for them (and we really don't want to).
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

We'll cross the .cc bridge when we get to it... no plans to use it yet.

On Fri, Oct 6, 2017 at 8:40 AM Craig Tiller <ctiller@google.com> wrote:

> Why doesn't the CMake stuff pull its configuration from build.yaml?
>
> On Fri, Oct 6, 2017 at 1:47 AM Jan Tattermusch <notifications@github.com>
> wrote:
>
>> *@jtattermusch* commented on this pull request.
>> ------------------------------
>>
>> In CMakeLists.txt
>> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/12843#discussion_r143137635>:
>>
>> > @@ -758,6 +758,7 @@ endif()
>>  add_dependencies(buildtests_cxx stress_test)
>>
>> Actually, you should at least add a comment to CMakeLists.txt.template
>> saying that we're using header-only stuff from abseil so we didn't setup
>> proper dependency the way it's done for other third_party deps.
>>
>> Btw, seems like abseil only supports building with bazel - so currently
>> we cannot use anything else than header-only stuff unless we want to write
>> Makefile and CMakeLists.txt for them (and we really don't want to).
>>
>> —
>> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
>> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
>> <https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/12843#discussion_r143137635>, or mute
>> the thread
>> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AJpudRLKTRe9Pma7aG_qQ2oddZ7mCwbVks5spekUgaJpZM4PvYzX>
>> .
>>
>

There are 2 answers:
1. The cmake header inclusion model is a bit more complicated than just
pulling CPPFLAGS from build.yaml and ideally, we'd be depending only on a
target generated by our dependency's CMakeLists.txt and we wouldn't need to
add the include directories using target_include_directories explicitly at
all (a properly configured cmake target has enough metadata so that CMake
knows what are the public/private headers and what are the libraries needed
to build). So explicitly specifying target_include_directories in our
CMakeLists.txt is a workaround to some extent (Some of the include dirs
might actually not be necessary even now, but it's hard to determine which
ones without a proper set of cmake distribution tests - so far I've been
only able to add some tests as I have a very limited time budget for CMake
improvements).
2. (the not very useful one) - we just haven't done it that way initially
and considering 1), it's arguably not the right think to do at all.
